title: Spine Health: Stay Strong and Flexible!
description: Learn about spine anatomy, its function, and tips for maintaining a healthy and flexible spine.

sections.title: Spine Anatomy: The Backbone of Your Body
content: The spine is a complex structure that provides support and flexibility. It is composed of **33 vertebrae** divided into **cervical**, **thoracic**, **lumbar**, **sacral**, and **coccygeal** regions.
Key components include the **vertebrae**, **intervertebral discs**, **spinal cord**, and **ligaments**. Together, these elements enable movement, protect the spinal cord, and support the body.

sections.title: How the Spine Works
content: The spine serves three primary functions: structural support, protection of the spinal cord, and enabling movement. It also absorbs shocks through the intervertebral discs, ensuring a smooth motion during activities.

sections.title: Tips for a Healthy Spine
content: 1. **Practice Good Posture**: Sit and stand with a straight back to reduce strain on your spine.
2. **Exercise Regularly**: Activities like yoga and swimming strengthen the spine and improve flexibility.
3. **Lift Properly**: Always bend your knees and keep your back straight when lifting heavy objects.
4. **Sleep on a Supportive Mattress**: Ensure your mattress provides proper back support.
5. **Stay Active**: Prolonged sitting can harm your spine. Take breaks to stretch and move around.
